source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_039_chunk6
evidence_span: Three types of deformation paths preceding relaxation were used: (1) constant strain rate tensile deformation, (2) constant load creep deformation, and (3) biaxial uniaxial creep
test_type: tensile deformation, creep deformation, biaxial uniaxial creep

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_039_chunk6
evidence_span: A cold-worked, stressrelieved (CwSR) commercial cladding was produced using similar thermo-mechanical processing encompassing tin contents ranging from 1.22 to $1 . 5 4 \%$

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_039_chunk6
evidence_span: Thermal creep testing, tension testing, contractile strain ratio (CSR) testing, and texture analysis were preformed over the range of tin contents
test_type: thermal creep testing, tension testing, contractile strain ratio testing, texture analysis

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_039_chunk6
evidence_span: Creep testing was performed at $3 9 9 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C }$ $( \bar { 7 } 5 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { F } )$

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_039_chunk6
evidence_span: The creep strength of Zircaloy-4 was strongly dependent on the tin content over the allowable composition range

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_039_chunk6
evidence_span: The steady state strain rates increased by factors of 6. 5, and 2 for the 0: 1, 1: 1, and 2: 1 stress states. respectively, as the tin content decreased toward the lower tin content limit of $1 . 2 0 \%$

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_039_chunk6
evidence_span: The ASTM Specification for Wrought Zirconium and Zirconium Alloy Seamless and Welded Tubes for Nuclear Service (B 353) has a tin content range of 1.20 to $1 . 7 0 \%$

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_039_chunk6
evidence_span: Typically, the tin content in the commercial alloy will be about 1.45
